sample_rows.title: Elucidation of the effects of "gratitude" in organizational management on individuals and organizations
sample_rows.abstract: The purpose of this study is to clarify the effect of employee gratitude feelings by gratitude management by conducting empirical studies at the individual and organizational levels. Specifically, we will (1) verify the physical changes of organizational employees by feeling gratitude, and (2) verify the ripple effect of gratitude management. In the first year, we planned to conduct an experiment by measuring brain waves and heart rate for people working in the organization to see if "gratitude" in the organizational scene would bring out positive emotions for the organizational employees. However, due to the influence of COVID-19, it became impossible to use the room where the experiment was originally planned. Even if the planned laboratory could be secured, it was difficult to keep a sufficient distance between the experimenter and the collaborators due to the small room, and the ventilation function was not sufficient. It was decided that it would be difficult to carry out the experiment in consideration of risk countermeasures, and it was unavoidable to abandon the experiment. Although it was not possible to conduct an empirical study, this study also organized the literature on "gratitude of organizational employees", so we focused on that. Although previous research on "gratitude" has been conducted in Japan and overseas, there is little literature on academic research on efforts to induce gratitude as organizational management. For future research, we plan to organize and clarify the definition of "gratitude" in previous research and the definition of "gratitude" used in organizational situations, and to refine the theoretical framework.

sample_rows.title: Current Situation and Challenges of Consumer Hostility in the US, China, and Korea in the Coronavirus Disease
sample_rows.abstract: What impact will the spread of the new coronavirus have on consumer animosity in the United States, China, and South Korea? The purpose of this research is to compare and analyze consumer hostility research, which has been attracting attention in the research area of global marketing in recent years, for consumers in the United States, China, and South Korea. Furthermore, by combining the results of this survey with research results in the field of global marketing communications, we will also try to present a new "global marketing communications" strategy for Japanese companies entering the market.

sample_rows.title: A study of the demand for tourism industry under covid-19 with a special reference to spatial economy
sample_rows.abstract: In Corona, domestic tourism is expected to have more tourism demand to "neighbors and surrounding areas" than to "far" due to movement restrictions. Therefore, we would like to measure the estimation model of domestic tourism demand while considering this "neighborhood and surrounding area population". Moreover, in spatial econometrics, it is possible to measure the correlation between regions. I would like to build a model that takes into account regional chains regarding the movement of people.

sample_rows.title: Geographical research on systems that bring about sustainable tourism in Japan
sample_rows.abstract: The epidemic of the new coronavirus (COVID-19) has drastically changed the world's tourism situation, and it is expected that domestic tourism will prevail in many regions for the foreseeable future. In such a situation, it is required that researchers who have the knowledge of existing research gather to clarify the regional, socio-economic conditions necessary for future tourism. It is also the perspective of sustainability of tourism, that is, the aim of sustainable tourism. In this study, in particular, by looking at each region of Japan from the perspective of regional resilience and understanding the sustainable system, it is sustainable for regions that will contribute to the sustainable development of tourist destinations in the future. The tourism model will be presented not only domestically but also overseas.

sample_rows.title: Creation and proposal of travel plans utilizing geographical analysis and achievements of ancient and medieval classical stages
sample_rows.abstract: The development of tourism in Japan due to the increase in inbound tourism has also created a gap between tourist destinations that become “overtourism” and areas that do not benefit from it. In addition, the global epidemic of COVID-19 has hit tourism hard. In future tourism, it is indispensable to pursue high-quality trips in terms of content and build trips that make you want to visit again and again, rather than regaining the “consumer trips” that are centered on inbound demand. Therefore, in this research, we geographically analyze the stage drawn in ancient and medieval classics, create and propose a high-quality travel plan (published on the web) that makes use of the results, and create new regional resources. Aim to utilize.
